alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 7:48PM MST until July 31 at 9:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MST/10 PM MDT/ THIS EVENING FOR NAVAJO COUNTY... At 745 PM MST /845 PM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated light rainfall Tsegi to Kayenta and northward into Monument Valley. Area washes and creeks are likely still running very high and the Flash Flood Warning will remain in effect. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tsegi, Kayenta, Navajo National Monument. This includes the following highways... Highway 160 between mile markers 368 and 404. Highway 163 between mile markers 394 and 408. State Route 564 between mile markers 375 and 383. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Narrow Canyon Wash, Tsegi Canyon, Tyende Creek, Dinnebito Wash, Laguna Creek, Moenkopi Wash, Cutfoot Wash, Shonto Wash, Parrish Creek and Capitan Wash, El. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
